tasks: Constructing explicit examples to show that locally trivial moduli functors do not always satisfy Schlessinger’s condition (H1) in positive characteristic
methods: Constructing examples using algebraic varieties in positive characteristic
results: Normal rational projective surface with one rational double point
title: Pathology of Formal Locally-Trivial Deformations in Positive Characteristic.pdf
abstract: We construct explicit examples that are algebraic varieties in pos- itive characteristic to show that locally trivial moduli functors do not always satisfy Schlessinger’s condition (H1) in [3], in contrast to the complex/characteristic 0 case. The ﬁrst example is an algebraic curve, and the second is a normal rational projective surface with only one rational double point.
